title: Lizzo tells Andy Cohen she has ‘beef’ with him after outing her relationship with Myke Wright
summary: Lizzo calls out Andy Cohen for outing her "private" relationship with boyfriend Myke Wright.
story: Lizzo is letting Andy Cohen know she has “beef” with him.

During a recent interview on SiriusXM’s “Andy Cohen Live,” the “About Damn Time” singer playfully accused Cohen of forcing her to reveal her romance with boyfriend Myke Wright during their last on-air chat.
“You know what?” said Lizzo, 36. “I really got beef with you because the last time we saw each other you f------ outed me!” (Warning: The below video contains profanity.)

Cohen agreed that he “inadvertently” pushed Lizzo to admit she had a boyfriend after asking about paparazzi pics of her and a “mystery man” during an April 2022 interview on his SiriusXM series “Radio Andy.”
Lizzo recalled that the moment was “so funny” because Wright was actually in the studio with her and Cohen at the time.

“I was in such a weird position because, like, we’re so private, but he was there and I was like, ‘I don’t want to say ‘no’ because I don’t want to (hurt him)'," she said.Cohen wondered if their exchange led to any awkwardness between Lizzo and Wright, who works as an actor and comedian.
“No. It started s--- with the world, though,” she responded, adding, “I think when the world sees two happy people, they want to destroy them.”
Lizzo and Wright made their relationship public in June 2022 after they attended a couple of events together.
In February 2023, Lizzo shared several images of her and Wright being affectionate at a pre-Grammys gala. She captioned the since-deleted post, “Hard launch.”
The following day, the couple walked the red carpet together at the 2023 Grammys.
Lizzo and Wright have known each other for many years. In 2016, they co-hosted MTV’s music series “Wonderland," and also posed together at the premiere of MTV’s “Teen Wolf” and “Sweet/Vicious.”
The couple have been romantically linked since October 2021.
“I’ve known him for over six years. He’s everything. We’re just in love. And that’s it,” Lizzo told Vanity Fair in an October 2022 interview.
The musician went on to say her heart belonged to Wright and Wright alone.
“I am not a polyamorous person, I’m not in love with multiple partners. That is not me. He’s the love of my life. We are life mates," said Lizzo.
She added “We’re like the mirror image of each other. We’re connected. But that doesn’t mean I was incomplete when I met him.”

title: The Lollapalooza 2025 lineup has been announced. Here are the performers and how to get tickets
summary: The Lollapalooza 2025 lineup includes Sabrina Carpenter, Olivia Rodrigo and Luke Combs. Here's how to get tickets to the festival in Chicago's Grant Park.
story: Sabrina Carpenter, Olivia Rodrigo, Luke Combs and Gracie Abrams are just a few of the headliners for Lollapalooza 2025.

The annual four-day music festival returns to Chicago's Grant Park from July 31 through Aug. 3, and will also feature headlining sets by Tyler, the Creator, Rüfüs Du Sol, Twice, A$AP Rocky, Korn and Doechii, organizers announced March 18.
Lollapalooza 2025 will feature more than 160 music acts spanning several genres who will perform across multiple stages.
Tickets for Lollapalooza go on sale March 20.
Here’s everything to know about Lollapalooza 2025.
What is the Lollapalooza 2025 lineup?

Lollapalooza 2025's headliners are Olivia Rodrigo, Tyler, the Creator, Sabrina Carpenter, Rüfüs Du Sol, Luke Combs, Twice, A$AP Rocky, Korn, Gracie Abrams and Doechii, whose single "Anxiety" has inspired a viral TikTok dance trend.
Other well-known artists on the bill this year include Bleachers (featuring Jack Antonoff), Cage the Elephant, T-Pain, Mk.gee and Foster the People.
More than 160 music acts will perform across multiple stages during the festival's four days. For a full lineup, visit lollapalooza.com.
When is Lollapalooza 2025?
Lollapalooza 2025 will take place July 31 through Aug. 3 at Grant Park in Chicago.
How to get tickets for Lollapalooza 2025
Four-day passes to Lollapalooza 2025 will be available at lower rates during a special one-hour presale on March 20 at 10 a.m. CT. Concertgoers must pre-register for the sale at lollapalooza.com.
Single-day tickets will go on sale at a later date. Concertgoers can sign up for the Lollapalooza SMS list to receive information about all Lollapalooza ticket sales for 2025.

title: Jen and Zac Affleck went to Chippendales and 'Mormon Wives' fans can't handle it
summary: Jen and Zac Affleck appear to return to Chippendales after their major fight in Season 1 of The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives.
story: Jen and Zac Affleck appear to have softened their stance on Chippendales.
The couple got into an epic fight after Jen Affleck went to a Chippendales show with her co-stars in Las Vegas in Season 1 of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives."
In a series of recent TikToks, the couple returns to the popular show, which is famous for its all-male dance troupe.

On March 18, the #MomTok influencer took to TikTok to share a video of herself and her husband at Chippendales. In the short clip, Zac Affleck appears in front of a Chippendales sign while lip syncing to a trending audio from "The Office" that says, "I need you to promise me that you'll be on your best behavior."
Jen Affleck then appears in front of the same sign and lip syncs, "I promised other people that I'd be on my worst behavior, and I gave them my word, so."
For a brief moment at the end of the clip, the reality star sits in a chair on stage, waving her arms in the air as she is surrounded by dancers.

TikTok user @_shelbyjones posted a video with additional footage from Jen Affleck’s appearance on stage. In the brief clip, the reality star — who is pregnant with her third child — appears to be enjoying the dancers’ performance.
Zac Affleck also posted his own video, a riff on the "Anxiety" by Doechii TikTok trend. The brief clip ends with the reality star dancing alongside some Chippendales dancers.
Jen Affleck’s fans had a lot to say about her appearance on stage.
“This is hilarious,” one TikToker commented on her video.
“She looks happy thats all that matters ... Jen you’re doing amazing,” another wrote.

Other social media users were skeptical about the couple's sudden change of heart about Chippendales, given it had sparked a fight. One TikToker called the videos “damage control” for Season 2 of the Hulu reality series.
“Now he wants to be chill,” another commented.

Others applauded the couple for seeming to evolve past the right, including one TikTok user who commented, “I’m loving this the growth u both are making and now seeing this as humor 🫶 and not letting it impact your marriage ppl need to understand no one perfect.”

During a girls' trip to Las Vegas, Jen Affleck's co-stars proposed a trip to see the dance troupe. Jen Affleck was nervous about going to Chippendales and worried about what her husband would say. In her mind, the show went "against everything we believe in as Mormons” and was "disrespectful" to her husband.
As she predicted, her husband was upset when he found out she went to Chippendales. Jen Affleck defended herself during a heated conversation.
“I’m a human being and I did nothing wrong in the situation,” Jen Affleck said on the phone.
Afterwards, she recapped the conversation to a co-star. Zac Affleck said he “didn’t want to be married to her” if she “does stuff like this," she summarized.
The show also zoomed in on a text Zac Affleck appeared to have sent Jen.

“Seriously, I don’t want to hear one more thing about your heart. Start taking accountability for your actions and for the situations you put yourself in. You’re a grown woman,” the text begins. “It doesn’t matter your intentions. You were there, and that’s the image you portray of yourself, your family, church etc.”

In an interview with TODAY.com about the moment, Jen Affleck said, “I think what was wrong about the situation was that he just didn’t trust me, and he didn’t trust that I could navigate the situation."
After some speculation about whether the couple would break up, Zac and Jen Affleck are going strong and expecting their third child.

title: How to watch ‘Good American Family,’ the new drama about Natalia Grace
summary: How to watch Good American Family, the new Hulu drama about Natalia Grace and Michael and Kristine Barnett, her adoptive parents.
story: The ongoing saga of Natalia Grace has inspired a new Hulu TV series, set to explore Grace’s polarizing story from multiple points of view.
Grace is a Ukrainian orphan who was born with a rare form of dwarfism. One set of her adoptive parents, Michael and Kristine Barnett, suspected that she was an adult masquerading as a child.

According to court documents obtained by TODAY.com, the Barnetts legally changed the date of her birth certificate to reflect an older age, rented her an apartment in which to live independently and moved to Canada with their biological children. The Barnetts were charged with “felony neglect of a dependent,” although Michael was found not guilty in October 2022 and charges against Kristine were dismissed in March 2023. The Barnetts have denied wrongdoing.

Grace has maintained she was child when she was adopted, and a DNA test taken on "The Curious Case of Natalia Grace" concluded her age at the time was approximately 22, which would mean she was a child when she met the Barnetts.

In an interview with TODAY.com, showrunner and creator Katie Robbins said the goal was not to create a “documentary version” of the saga, as that already exists — the Investigation Discovery series “The Curious Case of Natalia Grace“ premiered in 2023 and returned for a third season this year.

“We are taking creative license,” Robbins said. “How do we tell the most emotionally authentic version of this story, drawing from the information that we have and the places that we need to slightly heighten or embellish or adjust to create a compelling narrative story?”
Before the premiere of “Good American Family,” we’re breaking down everything you need to know about the series.
When does ‘Good American Family’ premiere?
The first two episodes of “Good American Family” will premiere on Hulu on March 19, 2025 at midnight ET.
Afterward, one episode will drop each week until the finale airs on April 30.
Episodes will be available to stream at midnight ET each week on Hulu and Hulu On Disney Plus.
What is ‘Good American Family’ about?

Per Hulu, “Good American Family” is “told from multiple points of view to reflect the contrasting narratives of its central characters.” The series is “inspired by real events involving a Midwestern couple who adopts a girl with a rare form of dwarfism.”
While raising Grace with their three biological children, Michael and Kristine Barnetts begin to question her age and background and “slowly start to wonder if she really is who she says she is.”

“As more and more questions emerge about their daughter, she fights her own battle to confront her past and what her future holds, in a showdown that ultimately plays out in the tabloids and the courtroom,” the series synopsis reads.
Producer Sarah Sutherland wants people to come to their own conclusions about the characters.

“Rather than try to just make a show that was pointing fingers, the hope was to sort of force you to live with these people and force you to think about what it is to move through the world and make these snap judgments. So we’ll let you watch and you make your own decision,” she said.
Who stars in ‘Good American Family’?
The cast features Ellen Pompeo as Kristine Barnett and Mark Duplass as Michael Barnett, Grace’s former adoptive parents, while Imogen Faith Reid plays the lead role as Natalia Grace.

Christina Hendricks and Jerod Haynes star as Cynthia and Antwon Mans, the couple who adopted Grace after the Barnetts. Other cast members include Sarayu Blue (Valika) and Dulé Hill (Brandon Drysdale).
Duplass told TODAY.com the role was a "joy to play."

"This is a story about perspective. And because we see this story from so many different perspectives, that means the character of Michael Barnett is so many different things at any given time ... and it’s deeply unsettling because of that, but again, a joy and an honor to play," he said.

title: Debra Messing 'could not believe' she's related to this politician after 'Finding Your Roots' episode
summary: Debra Messing spoke to TODAY about being related to Bernie Sanders and how she looked into whether she's related to Larry David.
story: Debra Messing is feeling the Bern.
The “Will & Grace” alum learned in a February episode of PBS’ “Finding Your Roots” that she is related to Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders, a fact which blew her away.
“Yes, he is my long-lost cousin,” she said while appearing on the 3rd hour of TODAY on March 18.
“I could not believe it,” she added.
Messing, who stars alongside Robert De Niro in the upcoming film “The Alto Knights,” says she also had to do some digging to find out if her Sanders connection meant she was related to Larry David.

David and Sanders learned they are distant cousins on a 2017 episode of “Finding Your Roots,” so Messing said her son, Roman, was curious about any possible family relation on their side of the family.

“My son, when I came home, he said, ‘You know, there was another show where Larry David found out that he was related to Bernie Sanders. So does that mean we’re related to Larry David?’ Because my son is really into comedy and loves Larry David,” Messing recalled.
It turned out to be false hope, though.
“And so I had to call and I was like, ‘Can you find out if we’re related?’ And they’re like, ‘We’re so sorry. It’s a different strain of DNA.’ And I broke my son’s heart,” Messing joked.

Like Messing, David, who has impersonated Sanders multiple times on “Saturday Night Live” and even appeared in a sketch with him once, was in awe when he discovered his relationship with the politician
“I was very happy about that,” David told Variety before their “Finding Your Roots” episode aired in 2017. “I thought there must have been some connection.”

title: Mariah Carey pokes fun at her long-running hatred of bad lighting in an awards acceptance speech
summary: Mariah Carey accepted an award with a moving and funny acceptance speech about her hatred of bad lighting and her love for her mom Patricia Carey.
story: The Queen of Christmas was seen outside of the holiday season, making a beautiful and funny acceptance speech at the iHeartRadio Music Awards on March 17.
Mariah Carey, the recipient of the 2025 Icon Award, used her acceptance speech to recognize her late mother, who passed away in August on the same day as her sister, Alison.
“On this Saint Patrick’s Day, I want to honor my mother, Patricia Carey, for giving me the gift of music,” Carey said of her mother, a Julliard-trained musician and voice coach of Irish descent.
Before her death, Carey wrote in her 2020 memoir, “The Meaning of Mariah Carey,” that music was a special connection between her and her mom.

“Music was something we genuinely connected on, and without pushing or becoming one of those overbearing stage mothers or ‘momagers,’ she instilled in me the power of believing in myself,” she wrote. “Whenever I mused about what I’d do ‘if I make it,’ she would cut me short and say, 'Don’t say “if I make it,” say, “when I make it.” Believe you can do it, and you will do it.’”
Carey provided TODAY.com with a statement on Aug. 26, explaining that her mom died over the weekend and her sister passed "in a tragic turn of events."

“I feel blessed that I was able to spend the last week with my mom before she passed,” Carey said in the statement. “I appreciate everyone’s love and support and respect for my privacy during this impossible time.”
In her acceptance speech on March 17, Carey also thanked her fans - whom she called her "Lambily."
“To my fans, Lambily. You’ve been with me through every step of this journey," she said. "Your love and loyalty are the greatest gift, and I’m endlessly thankful for each one of you.”
While the speech was emotional at times, Carey also sprinkled in some humor — beginning with a joke about the lighting.
“Is the lighting OK, because I don’t like bad lighting,” she said stepping up to the microphone — a joke which was met with a round of laughter, as well as internet reactions.
"I ain’t even a Mariah Carey fan but her checking if the lighting is good before she gives her speech that’s iconic," one X user wrote.
Carey has made headlines in the past about her aversion to certain types of lighting.
“I can’t with the overhead lighting,” she said in an October 2024 appearance on the "Las Culturistas" podcast. “Why do they do it to us? I shouldn’t say us, it’s not us, it’s me."

"I’m the one who’s the most tortured by the hideous lighting in elevators, doorway, gyms — not that I go to the gym, I’m just saying. It’s hideous lighting. The sun is OK if it’s sunset, I’ll gladly go outside and put a little hat on or whatever and that’ll be pretty because the sunlight caresses your skin. But it’s bad for you, so you have to be careful. But overhead lighting I don’t think so honey. Please stop it! Everywhere I go, shut the lights! I don’t want to see them no more. Overhead lighting, it makes me sick," she continued.
This goes back years — she said in a 2015 US Weekly roundup that she has an "extreme aversion to overhead lighting."
"In my opinion, elevator lighting is toxic!" she continued.
She then asked the audience if they liked her outfit, or "ensemb" in her words, as she turned around in a circle to raucous applause.

“As a kid, I used to listen to my favorite artist on the radio and dream of being on the airwaves myself. Now, for those of you who may not know what airwaves are, think of it as the non-Wi-Fi version of streaming, OK?” she joked.
“Even now I still get excited when I hear one of my songs playing on the radio," Carey continued in her speech. "It never stops being magical.”

She continued on to thank a myriad of people, including John Sykes, the president of iHeartRadio, who was coincidentally her first manager, and the interns who would greet her with a smile at the radio stations at 7 a.m.
"Not exactly my ideal wake up time," she joked.

Before her speech, Muni Long performed "We Belong Together" and Tori Kelly performed "Always Be My Baby" as a tribute to Carey's legacy. Carey was spotted singing along to Kelly's performance in the crowd.

After the performances, host LL Cool J took the stage, explaining why Carey was awarded with the honor of the Icon Award, joining the ranks of past winners like Cher, Elton John, Bon Jovi and Jennifer Lopez.
“Year after year, decade after decade, Mariah has continued to share her stunning voice, her songwriting and her deeply personal story with millions of fans everywhere,” Cool J said.

“Along the way, Mariah has broken virtually every chart record around the globe, including the record for a solo artist with 19 No. 1 hits. This is the extraordinary story, a successful story of a hero, a fantasy, a butterfly, a vision of love, who always has us feeling emotions. One of the greatest singers, songwriters and artists of all time, the 2025 iHeartRadio Icon: Mariah Carey.”
Carey thanked Cool J for his kind words in her speech, as well as Long and Kelly for their performances.

title: Tracy Morgan shares cause for his illness at Knicks game: ‘I’m doing ok now’
summary: Tracy Morgan says the culprit was food poisoning after he had to be taken out of Madison Square Garden in a wheelchair when he fell ill during a New York Knicks game.
story: Tracy Morgan says the culprit was food poisoning after he had to be taken out of Madison Square Garden in a wheelchair when he fell ill while sitting courtside during a New York Knicks game.

The comedian shared on Instagram on March 18 that he is recovering after doctors told him some bad food was responsible for him vomiting on the ground at the game and being taken to the hospital. The incident occurred during the third quarter of the Knicks' win over the Miami Heat on March 17, causing the game to be delayed.

"Thank you for all your concern!" Morgan wrote on Instagram alongside a photo of him giving a thumbs-up in a hospital bed. "I’m doing ok now and doctors say it was food poisoning. Appreciate my MSG family for taking such good care of me and I need to shout out the crew that had to clean that up. Appreciate you!"
The Knicks went on to a 116-95 victory over Miami after Morgan was removed via wheelchair as he was seen covering his mouth with a towel. Morgan is a courtside regular at Knicks games.
"More importantly, the Knicks are now 1-0 when I throw up on the court so maybe I’ll have to break it out again in the playoffs 😅 #goknicks," Morgan joked on Instagram.
Fans wished for a speedy recovery for the comedian.
"Glad you’re feeling better. Always hilarious even with food poisoning," one commented on Instagram.
"So glad that it was a straightforward problem. Feel better soon!" another wrote.

Morgan has persevered through a host of health issues in the last 15 years. He was a passenger in a limousine bus hit by a Walmart tractor trailer in 2014, which resulted in a broken leg, broken ribs, brain trauma and a coma. He also had a kidney transplant in 2010.

title: Savannah Chrisley says Grayson Chrisley had to ‘grow up so fast’ after parents went to prison
summary: Savannah Chrisley says her parents' prison sentence has been tough on her younger brother, Grayson Chrisley.
story: Savannah Chrisley says her parents' prison sentence has been tough on her younger brother, Grayson Chrisley.
When Todd and Julie Chrisley reported to their respective prisons in January 2023, their youngest son was just 16 years old. Today, the 18-year-old is a college student.

Todd Chrisley and his wife Julie Chrisley were found guilty of financial fraud, tax evasion and conspiracy to defraud the United States in November 2022. He was sentenced to 12 years in prison while she received a 7-year sentence.
While serving as her brother's legal guardian over the last two years, Savannah Chrisley has noticed the impact her parents’ absence has had on Grayson Chrisley.

“He had to grow up so fast and I hate it,” the 27-year-old told People in a new interview. “But at the same time, this whole situation has taught him how cruel the world can be, and how you have to protect yourself. And as cruel as it’s been, he also has kept this softness about him, and he’s in therapy every single week."
Savannah Chrisley went on to applaud her younger brother for trying to maintain a positive attitude while his parents serve their prison sentences.
"I just love to see the heart that he has, and how he’s shown up,” she said.

The reality star continued, saying, “That’s how you want any man in your life to be is to show up for you and show up well, and show up even when they get it wrong. He’s learning those lessons at 16 years old, when all this happened. And now he’s 18, and it’s just, I could not be more proud."
Todd and Julie Chrisley were sentenced to prison in 2022 after being indicted on 12 counts of wire fraud, conspiracy to commit bank fraud and conspiracy to defraud the United States in 2019.
Savannah Chrisley took on custody of Grayson Chrisley and her niece, Chloe Chrisley, when her parents went to prison. She said Grayson Chrisley says Savannah Chrisley "saved" him and Chloe.
“He says that. But I look at him and I’m like, he saved me more times than I can count,” she said.
Grayson Chrisley is now attending college at the University of Alabama and is "thriving," according to his sister.

“As it got closer, he was like, ‘I don’t know if I can do this. I don’t want to do this.’ He was so afraid of leaving me because he knew just how helpful he was to me, and how we just have this bond together. I looked at him, I was like, ‘It’s OK,’” she said.
Savannah Chrisley encouraged her brother to follow his dreams of pursuing a career in sports management.
“I want him to find happiness and a sense of self, and fulfillment. I want him to be so proud of the person that he is," she said.

title: Are the books in 'The White Lotus' Season 3 sending a message about the characters?
summary: There are books in Season 3 of the White Lotus. Here's what the books they're reading say about the characters.
story: Warning: This post contains spoilers for Season 3 of "The White Lotus."
Fans are reading into everything in “The White Lotus.” Literally.
Only three episodes remain in the third season of “The White Lotus,” and fans are amping up their quest for clues into which character will wind up dead in the water at the Thai resort.
For avid watchers, everything on the show could be another tip — from the opening credits to the books the characters are reading.

Jack Edwards, a British YouTuber with nearly 1.5 million subscribers watching his content about books, posted a TikTok earlier this month about the books in “The White Lotus” and what they could signify for the characters who are reading them.
More than 600,000 views on that TikTok later, Edwards tells TODAY.com he’s continued to look for books in Season 3 so he can present his findings to his followers and other “White Lotus” fans.

“While it’s not necessary to know what the books are or what they represent, it is added texture,” Edwards says. “They’re fun Easter eggs that give us an added insight into the characters that if you’re eagl-eyed enough to spot — it’s quite a thrilling experience to be able to hunt them down.”
Edwards has made other videos about the seeming intentionality of the books characters are reading in "White Lotus" Seasons 1 and 2.

After spotting a few books throughout the first few episodes of Season 3, it was Episode 4 that many of the novels came into view — but some detective work on Edwards' part was required to find out which, he says.
“Let me just say Mike White doesn’t make it easy for us, because these books are so obscure,” Edwards says with a laugh, referring to the show’s creator.
The 26-year-old put his degree in English literature and his internet detective skills to the test to identify the books the characters in “The White Lotus” have been reading.

“I always said that I thought my my English degree was just a long-term investment into being good at pub quizzes, but it turns out it’s also good identifying books in ‘The White Lotus,’” he says with a grin.

Edwards says he appreciates the detail behind the props and wardrobe design on the show, because it allows viewers to think about what they are seeing each week, as opposed to binging the full season in one watch.

“There’s something quite pleasant and satisfactory about having to linger on a show like this, where it’s being rolled out weekly,” Edwards says. “I think maybe that’s why we’re seeing so many theories and so much debate around what could possibly happen.”
Here are the books featured on Season 3 of “The White Lotus — and what could be in store for the characters based on what they’re reading.
'Hunger' by Knut Hamsun

Lochlan (Sam Nivola) is reading one of the first books seen in Season 3. During Episode 4, Lochlan’s older brother Saxon (Patrick Schwarzenegger) asks him what he’s doing, and he replies that he’s reading. Saxon responds, “Why?”
Edwards says the scene represents the difference between the two brothers. Even though they are siblings and had almost identical educations, one values reading and the other does not.

“One of those characters wants to learn, is inquisitive, and the other one is the sort of nepo baby figure who has had everything handed to him on a plate,” he says. “So even there, I think we can see a different dynamic in who is reading and who isn’t.”

In the scene, Lochlan holds up the book, which Edwards says he watched frame by frame, trying to get a clear shot of the book. He  ultimately identified the cover as an Oxford World's Classics edition.

“So I Googled, ‘How many Oxford World’s Classics are there?’ and it was, like, a horror movie sound effect when I realized there were 929. But I am nothing if not committed to the bit, and I scrolled through them,” he says, noting there is a full Oxford archive online.
On the penultimate page, Edwards finally spotted one that looked familiar: “Hunger” by Knut Hamsun.

According to the book’s description, “Hunger” follows an aspiring writer as he tries to make ends meet in the city. The narrative becomes blurred as the voice of the narrator shifts between a level assessment of his situation and wild outbursts of anger and despair.

“When I was looking into it, it’s about a young man who was trying to establish himself, but he does so with unease and sensitivity,” Edwards says. “And when I then thought about Lochlan’s character, I was like, well, that completely adds up for who he is.”
“So it’s actually quite intentional, I think who reads and who doesn’t,” he continues.
'Surrounded by Narcissists' by Thomas Erikson
Viewers first see Belinda (Natasha Rothwell) reading a book alone by the pool. But almost as soon as she picks it up, she puts it back down to go inside to research Greg (Jon Gries).

When she puts the book down on her desk, Edwards was able to see part of the cover and the words “Surrounded By,” which he says was more than enough for him to narrow it down to “Surrounded by Narcissists” by Thomas Erikson.
Erikson’s book describes what qualities make up a narcissist, and teaches readers how to manage other people’s narcissistic behaviors so they can pursue a happier life, the book’s description reads.

“So again, that feels like a very deliberate choice,” he says. “She seems to be the person who is able to contextualize this hotel. As we’re seeing it, it’s the Full Moon Party in Thailand right now — it’s a festival — and no one seems to be engaging with it at all, whereas Belinda is much more aware of her surroundings and the social hierarchies of the space she’s in.”

“We can see that Belinda is much more self-aware than the rest of the characters about their kind of social status and where they exist within the hierarchy,” he adds. “So I thought that was interesting, that she’s reading ‘Surrounded by Narcissists,’ and it feels like a fun commentary for the people who notice.”
Belinda is seen reading the book again in Episode 5, as she’s trying to relax in her room when she starts hearing a noise (which ends up being the lizard Pornchai chases out of her room).
'The Beautiful and the Damned' by F. Scott Fitzgerald
Parker Posey’s character Victoria Ratliff reads F. Scott Fitzgerald’s “The Beautiful and the Damned” throughout Season 3 of the show.
The meaning of the title can be taken literally in her character’s case, Edwards says.
“This family is beautiful, like those genes are strong,” he says. “But from this episode, we can see this family was doomed.”

“The Beautiful and the Damned” is widely believed to have been based on Fitzgerald’s relationship with his wife Zelda Fitzgerald. The book follows a 25-year-old Harvard graduate who falls deeply in love and enters into a reckless marriage. The pair live a life of decadence, thinking they will receive inheritance money, but their lifestyle ultimately leads to their ruin and the end of their marriage.
“That book is about success and money and wealth and how relationships survive in times of difficulty,” he says.

The book is also about substance abuse — specifically alcoholism. "I think we’re seeing substance abuse being referenced a little bit more in the show. But again, it feels very deliberate," Edwards says.
Chelsea's book
Aimee Lou Wood's character Chelsea reads a book throughout the season, though Edwards says he hasn't been able to get a good enough view of the book to identify it.

“I need a few more clips of her reading. Every time I’m like, ‘Come on Mike. Give us another shot on the other side this time, please!’ But I feel like they drip feed them throughout the series, so hopefully, next episode,” he says. “I just want you to know if they show a clip of her reading that book from the front, just know I’m jumping for joy at home.”

Some Reddit users have hypothesized the book could be “Start Where You Are: How to Accept Yourself and Others” by Pema Chodron due to its light purple cover, but it is unclear if it’s the exact book Chelsea is reading at this point in the season.
According to the book's description, readers work with slogans and meditation practices to work on their inner pain and discover joy.
Piper's book
Piper (Sarah Catherine Hook) can be seen reading a book called "The Loving Kindness" in the third season as well, though Edwards thinks it may be a book created specifically for her character.
In Episode 5, Piper reveals to her parents that she didn't actually want to go to Thailand to write her thesis — it's because she wants to move to the country to study under a monk.

“I think that it’s a fake book, and that it’s that it’s meant to be the monk that she’s studying,” Edwards says. “I think it's interesting that she’s more willing to engage in text. It’s more palatable when it’s a book rather than the actual person who could challenge her.”

title: The 'Happy Gilmore 2' trailer is here — and so is its release date
summary: Adam Sandler returns to his role as a renowned golfer in "Happy Gilmore 2." Find out cast details, when it will be available to watch, its streaming home and more.
story: "Happy Gilmore 2" looks like it's going to drive some serious laughs.

The official trailer for the 1996 sequel dropped on Tuesday, March 18, and it shows the return of Happy Gilmore, played by Adam Sandler. The clip shows Happy getting back into golf after he left the sport behind following his big championship win in the first movie.
"I haven't swung a club in years," he says in the trailer, before admitting that he's a "little intimidated" by his new competition.
However, Happy tackles the challenge head-on. In a video montage, he's seen celebrating with a crowd after he appears to make a phenomenal shot on the course.
"Happy Gilmore 2" also sees Sandler reunite with some of his co-stars — Julie Bowen, Christopher McDonald and Ben Stiller — from the first film, as well as some new faces, such as Bad Bunny.
In the sequel, Bowen’s character, Virginia Venit, continues to be a love interest for Happy.
"We're not done with golf. I can see the Happy I fell in love with," she tells him in the trailer.
"Happy Gilmore 2" is set to be released on Netflix on July, 25, 2025.
While appearing on "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon" last summer, Sandler teased the film and revealed why he wanted to make a sequel to the comedy that stole fans' hearts in the '90s.

“People have been asking me for a long time, ‘Do 'Happy Gilmore 2,’' and I was always like, ‘Nah, I’ll only let you down,’” he said in August 2024, right before he started shooting the movie. “But then me and my buddy, Tim Herlihy, we came up with this idea. We’re really excited about it."
Sandler also hinted that some athletes will be making an appearance in "Happy Gilmore 2," such as Travis Kelce.

“We have a nice something for Travis. He’s going to come by. He’s a very nice guy, you guys would love him in real life,” he said. “What a big, handsome guy. Funny and cool as hell. He’s a stud, and he’s so funny.”

title: Tracy Morgan leaves New York Knicks game after appearing to get sick
summary: Tracy Morgan left the NBA game at MSG in a wheelchair when the New York Knicks played the Miami Heat after he appeared to throw up.
story: Comedian Tracy Morgan was taken out of Madison Square Garden in a wheelchair during the New York Knicks home game against the Miami Heat on March 17 after seemingly falling ill.
Video and photographs captured what appeared to be the comedian wiping vomit from his face as he sat in his courtside seat during the third quarter of the Knicks' 116-95 victory.
Cellphone video also showed Morgan in a wheelchair with people surrounding him and fans looking on as he was wheeled away while he covered his mouth with a towel.
The incident delayed the game for more than 10 minutes, according to The Associated Press.

“We hope Tracy feels better soon and look forward to seeing him back courtside,” a spokesperson for Madison Square Garden said in a statement to NBC News about Morgan, who is often seen attending Knicks games.
It’s unclear what was wrong with Morgan. Representatives for the “30 Rock” star and the NBA did not respond to NBC News' requests for more information as of March 17.

Morgan has endured a series of high-profile medical issues over the years. In 2014, he wound up in a coma and suffered brain trauma, a broken leg and multiple broken ribs when a limousine bus in which he was a passenger was hit by a Walmart tractor trailer in New Jersey. The crash killed his friend, comedian James McNair, and injured two other people in the limousine.
Morgan also previously had a kidney transplant in 2010.
Professionally, Morgan appeared on February’s “SNL50” anniversary special, starring in a “Black Jeopardy” sketch that was most notable for Eddie Murphy portraying Morgan.

“This is incredible,” he said on the “SNL50: The Red Carpet” before the show, according to People. “Just thank the Lord that I’m a part of this, that I survived the accident and I’m alive to be here for this.”

NBC also announced earlier this month that Morgan was set to appear in a comedy pilot for the network about a “disgraced former football player named Reggie who’s on a mission to rehabilitate his image.”

Morgan is slated to executive produce the project, as will his former “30 Rock” co-star and fellow “SNL” alum Tina Fey. Daniel Radcliffe and another former “SNL” cast member, Bobby Moynihan, are also expected to star.

title: Who went home on ‘The Bachelor’ tonight, March 17? Here’s Grant Ellis’ final 2
summary: Who went home on the March 17 Fantasy Suites episode of The Bachelor? Here's who made it to the final 2 following fantasy suites.
story: And just like that, we have arrived at a time-honored tradition in the "Bachelor" franchise: Fantasy suites.

Grant Ellis took his remaining three women, whittled down from a cast of 25, to the Dominican Republic, a country he has ties to. During his one-on-one with Juliana Pasquarosa, he revealed his grandmother is from the Dominican Republic.
What happened during the Fantasy Suites? Who went home? Find out below.
Who were in the Final 3 of ‘The Bachelor’?
Tears were shed on their one-on-one date — many. Juliana opened up about her past relationship and concluded that she thought Grant was an "amazing man."
He seemed equally chuffed and said he was falling in love with her. "I'm so wrapped up in my feelings for this woman. I feel like she could be my wife," she said.
The next morning, Grant said it "meant a lot to him" that she opened up. He also, in a rare move for "The Bachelor," Grant ate and drank real food.
Zoe and Grant essentially had their first one-on-one date of the season during this episode. It started with yoga done in complete silence  — which both decided they weren't fond of.
Grant explained why Zoe made it this far even though they hadn't had much time together.

"Regardless of us not having a one-on-one date, I wanted to hear more about her. I wanted to see her family. I wanted to take that chance," he said of Zoe. At her hometowns, Grant said he saw the "real Zoe."

The two acknowledged their emotional distance and that, until now, they hadn't had a chance to connect deeply. Grant proceeded to catch Zoe up on his life including the story of her father, who struggled with addiction.
They spent the night together.
Heading into Fantasy Suites, Litia was worried because she didn't want Grant to be intimate with other people. While ziplining with Grant, her stomach hurt from nerves (and maybe from heights).
The two had a conversation at dinner about his other relationships. When Grant asked Litia to go to the Fantasy Suite, she brought up intimacy.
"It's hard for me now because there are still people here. I have to make decisions that will help me protect my feelings and my peace. Sex is not on the table," she said.
Grant said he could see Litia as his wife and then — gasp! — said he loved her.
Litia was at ease. "I feel like you understand me. Those are things I have not had before," she said. Then she told him she loved him.

They also had a conversation about where they would live after "Th Bachelor." Litia said she would be happy to leave Utah. Grant said his father was in rehab in New Jersey and so he wanted to go back.
"We love each other so we'll be able to work through whatever obstacles come our way," he said.
He called Litia a "once in a lifetime woman" and said they're "supposed to be together."
Who went home at the end of the March 17 episode?
Grant reflected on a "really monumental" week but wanted to "go with his heart."
He gave his first rose to Litia and his second to Juliana, meaning Zoe went home.
Grant walked a tearful Zoe out and explained that this was "really hard" for him. Zoe said she was "grateful" for her time with Grant. "I think we both put a lot into this," she said.
Grant said, in a confessional, that he and Zoe "just weren't" in a place to get married.
As for what's next? "I'm torn and I don't know what I'm going to do," he said.
He told his family, in a preview for the next episode, that he's feeling indecisive.

title: Taylor Swift shares new clip from 'Eras Tour' opening night during iHeartRadio Music Awards
summary: Taylor Swift celebrated and reflected on her epic “Eras Tour," while also sharing a new clip of her performance from opening night.
story: Taylor Swift celebrated and reflected on her epic “Eras Tour.”
The superstar’s nearly two-year tour was recognized as the “tour of the century” during the 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards in Los Angeles on March 17.
In honor of its success, Swift thanked her fans for supporting her, as well as shared a never-before-seen performance from opening night.

“I really can’t tell you how much this means to me,” she said. “This is actually the two-year anniversary of the first show of the ‘Eras Tour’, so I’ve been doing a lot of processing since I’ve been off the road these last few months. People often say that sometimes the greatest challenges in life end up being something you’re so proud of, or end up being the most gratifying feeling in the end, if you can rise to the occasion.”
Swift called the tour “the most challenging thing I’ve ever done in my life.”

“It’s a three-and-a-half hour show, more shows than I’ve ever done on a tour, and it really was the most gratifying thing I’ve ever done. I think about that tour constantly. I’m so proud of it,” she said. “The only reason I was able to take on those challenges, among others, the ambition of the production, the length of the show, the amount of shows, all the different countries we played, that’s all because the fans. To the fans, you made these songs for the last couple decades into what they became so that we could do a three-and-a-half-hour set list.”

She continued, “You had the passion and the generosity to care about traveling to see us on tour in all these places all over the world. It blows my mind, I’m never going to stop being grateful for it, and I appreciate this more than you know. Thank you so much for honoring this tour.”
She concluded by taking her Swifties back and sharing an exclusive performance from the first night of the tour two years ago.
The clip shows Swift in a burgundy dress, playing the guitar and performing “Mirrorball.”
The singer was up for 10 awards during the 2025 ceremony, including artist of the year and best collaboration.
Swift first announced her stadium tour in November 2022. Swift said at the time the shows would be “a journey through the musical eras of my career (past and present!).”

What came next was a concert experience that celebrated her 11 albums. Her first show was in Glendale, Arizona, on March 18, 2023, and she would go on to play 148 more shows across five continents and 50 cities.
The tour also broke record attendances, boosted economies and became the highest-grossing concert tour of all time. She had her final show on Dec. 8 in Vancouver.
To highlight the tour, Swift also released the “Eras Tour” concert film, which included acoustic songs and special surprises for Swifties.

title: Justin Theroux and Nicole Brydon Bloom get married in Mexico
summary: Justin Theroux and Nicole Brydon Bloom are officially husband and wife. The couple got married in a beach wedding in Mexico.
story: Justin Theroux and Nicole Brydon Bloom are officially husband and wife.

The couple got married over the weekend in a beach wedding in Xpu Há, Mexico, according to Vogue. The magazine shared the first photos from their destination celebration that included celebrity guests like Jimmy Kimmel, Ben Stiller, Paul Rudd and Beanie Feldstein, among others.
The 30-year-old “Paradise” star wore a custom dress designed by Victoria Beckham, Vogue reported.
The couple met in 2022 through their mutual friend, actor Luisa Jacobson, at a private party in New York. After, Bloom received a text from Theroux after she borrowed his gloves on the cold night.
“This yours?” Bloom recalled the text reading, she told Vogue. “It was a picture of him holding my little criss-crossed diamond ring which I had worn, and sadly assumed I’d lost, the night before.”

“Turns out it had slipped off my cold finger into his large gloves when I returned them,” she continued. “Justin put his hands into the glove the next morning and the ring slid halfway onto his finger. He likes to joke that I proposed first, the very first night we met!”
Theroux, 53, also shared how he knew that Bloom was “the one” after meeting her.

“I pointed her out across the room to my friend Rassi and when he saw her he did a double take, turned to me and literally said, ‘She is the one,’” he shared. “I had no way of knowing how prescient his comment would turn out to be. I then begged him to go over to collect her name, which like an idiot I had not gotten.”
The actors got engaged over the summer in 2024, while on vacation in Italy.
During an interview with Hoda Kotb on TODAY Sept. 4, Theroux confirmed his “wonderful” engagement to his “stunning” fiancée.
“I feel fantastic. It’s been a wonderful, whirlwind couple of weeks,” the “Beetlejuice Beetlejuice” actor said.
During a Feb. 7 TODAY appearance, Bloom was asked how it felt to call Theroux fiancé, she replied, “It’s getting more and more normal for me.”
“We were friends for a little while before we started dating,” she said, “and I think that’s actually really nice how it happens.”
This is Theroux's second marriage. He was previously married to Jennifer Aniston.

title: What to remember from Haymitch Abernathy’s story before ‘Sunrise on the Reaping’
summary: What happened to Haymitch Abernathy in "The Hunger Games"? Here's what to remember about the character before "Sunrise on the Reaping."
story: We know the story of Katniss Everdeen's time in the arena. Now, Suzanne Collins is telling the tale of how Katniss' mentor, Haymitch Abernathy, survived the Hunger Games — more than 20 years before Katniss' story begins.

In "Sunrise on the Reaping," the fifth book in the "Hunger Games" franchise, Collins chronicles the events of the 50th Hunger Games. The annual event sees children from the districts in the dystopian country of Panem fight to the death as entertainment for its Capitol — a punishment for a decades-old rebellion.

The first "Hunger Games" book, which was published in 2008, follows the events of the 74th Hunger Games, when 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen from District 12 famously volunteered as tribute in her sister's place. The next two books in the series see her become a reluctant leader of a districtwide rebellion against the Capitol and face off against Panem's dictatorial president, Coriolanus Snow.

Collins returned to Panem in 2020 with the book "The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes," which tells Snow's villain origin story against the backdrop of the 10th annual Hunger Games. It details how he turned the Games into a spectacle while mentoring District 12 tribute Lucy Gray Baird.
"Sunrise on the Reaping," out March 18, is Collins' second spinoff book of the "Hunger Games" trilogy.
Here's what to remember before returning to the world of Panem.
Who is Haymitch Abernathy?

Haymitch Abernathy is introduced in the first "Hunger Games" book as the drunken mentor of Katniss and her male tribute counterpart, Peeta Mellark. As the only surviving victor from District 12, Haymitch is tasked with preparing Katniss and Peeta for the Games.

In the first book, he travels with them to the Capitol, but he spends most of his time drinking. After Katniss fights back against his perceived indifference, he realizes her potential to succeed in the Games, and he helps Katniss and Peeta strategize.
During the Games, he's also responsible for sending resources, including water and medicine, bought by sponsors to his tributes in the arena.
While mentoring Katniss and Peeta, he gradually reveals things about his own traumatic experience in the 50th Games, also known as the Second Quarter Quell.
What is a Quarter Quell?

A Quarter Quell is a special version of the Hunger Games that comes around every 25 years. Each Quarter Quell brings a different twist. For Haymitch's Games, there were double the amount of tributes, making him one of four tributes reaped from District 12.

The second "Hunger Games" book, "Catching Fire," follows the third Quarter Quell, or the 75th Hunger Games. This time around, tributes were reaped from the pool of surviving victors. For District 12, that pool consists of Katniss, Peeta and Haymitch, guaranteeing the trilogy's heroine would go back into the arena. While Haymitch was named the male tribute by the luck of the draw, Peeta immediately volunteers to take his place.

During "Catching Fire," Haymitch again serves as Katniss and Peeta's mentor. But in the background, he also coordinates with District 13's underground resistance effort and undercover rebel Gamemaker Plutarch Heavensbee to rescue tributes from the arena.

At the end of the book, Katniss finally learns of the conspiracy to start a second rebellion from Haymitch. In "Mockingjay," he serves as one of the rebellion's leaders, providing unconditional support to Katniss as conflict between her and District 13's President Coin emerges.
What happened during the 50th Hunger Games?
Well, we're about to find out.
The book's synopsis teases what's ahead for Haymitch.

"Haymitch Abernathy is trying not to think too hard about his chances," it reads. "All he cares about is making it through the day and being with the girl he loves. When Haymitch’s name is called, he can feel all his dreams break. He’s torn from his family and his love, shuttled to the Capitol with the three other District 12 tributes: a young friend who’s nearly a sister to him, a compulsive oddsmaker, and the most stuck-up girl in town. As the Games begin, Haymitch understands he’s been set up to fail. But there’s something in him that wants to fight ... and have that fight reverberate far beyond the deadly arena."

Notably, the first three books allude to significant moments from Haymitch’s time in the arena. In "Catching Fire," Katniss and Peeta even watch tape from the 50th Hunger Games to prepare for the Third Quarter Quell.
We learn that one of the female tributes from District 12 was a girl named Maysilee Donner, and she and Haymitch form an alliance at some point in the Games.

Haymitch spends much of the Games exploring the edge of the arena, trying to see what lies at the end of it. When he finally reaches the edge, he finds a force field. That force field becomes his saving grace. He ultimately wins the Games after the only other remaining tribute throws an ax toward him and the edge of the arena — only for the weapon to rebound and kill her.

After his time in the arena, we know his family and girlfriend are murdered by President Snow for his perceived defiance. He turns to alcohol to cope with the trauma and the consistent loss of the tributes he mentors in the Games until Katniss and Peeta's turn.
At the end of "Mockingjay," he returns to District 12 with Katniss and Peeta and takes up raising geese as the country of Panem rebuilds.

title: Melinda French Gates reacts to ex-husband Bill Gates calling their divorce a ‘mistake’
summary: Does Melinda Gates regret her divorce from Bill Gates? The 60-year-old philanthropist reacted to her ex-husband calling their split “the mistake I most regret.”
story: Melinda French Gates isn't thinking twice about her divorce from billionaire Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates.
The 60-year-old philanthropist reacted to her ex-husband calling their split “the mistake I most regret” during an interview with Elle for the magazine’s 2025 Women of Impact issue.
“You’ve clearly Googled more than I have,” said French Gates, reportedly rolling her eyes. “Look, divorces are painful, and it’s not something I would wish on any family.”
“But again, I knew when I got divorced, I would be okay on my own. And I think that was the most important thing,” she added.

Gates and French Gates announced their decision to go their separate ways after 27 years of marriage in May 2021. The couple share three children: daughters Jennifer Gates Nassar, 28, and Phoebe Gates, 22, and son Rory Gates, 25.
The couple’s high-profile divorce came amid rumors of infidelity on Gates’ part.
In May 2022, Gates described the split to TODAY co-anchor Savannah Guthrie as “definitely a sad thing.”
“I have responsibility for causing a lot of pain to my family. It was a tough year. I feel good that all of us are moving forward now,” he said.
When Savannah pressed Gates to say if he had been unfaithful during the marriage, he responded, “I certainly made mistakes and I take responsibility,” but didn’t elaborate at the time.
“I don’t think delving into the particulars at this point is constructive. But yes, I caused pain and I feel terrible about that,” he added.
During a Jan. 25, 2025, interview with The Times of London, Gates referred to the divorce as his most regrettable “mistake.”
“You would have to put that at the top of the list. There are others but none that matter. The divorce thing was miserable for me and Melinda for at least two years," he said.
The tech giant went on to describe how his long marriage to French Gates kept him “grounded” during years of nearly unparalleled professional success and global fame.

“There is a certain wonderfulness to spending your entire adult life with one person because of the memories and depth of things you have done and having kids together,” he said. “When Melinda and I met, I was fairly successful but not ridiculously successful — that came during the time that we were together.
“So, she saw me through a lot,” he added.
The following month, Gates clarified his comments during a Feb. 4. appearance on TODAY, saying both he and French Gates were in good places in their individual lives.
He also called his partner of more than a year, Paula Hurd, the widow of former Oracle CEO Mark Hurd, a “serious girlfriend.”

“I moved past the divorce, Melinda’s doing well. I got a lot of work that I love to do,” he said. “Despite the fact that the divorce wasn’t great, having those three kids and the work we were able to do, even if I knew it wouldn’t last forever, I would still do it again.”

title: Is ‘Adolescence,’ Netflix’s latest hit, based on a true story? What the creator has said
summary: Is Adolescence based on a true story? What the creator said about the real influences behind the TV show.
story: "Adolescence," Netflix's latest hit, follows the fallout of 13-year-old Jamie Miller's (Owen Cooper) arrest for the murder of a female classmate.
Critics are saying "Adolescence" is "complete perfection" and a harrowing, hard-to-watch that looks at the challenges and pitfalls young people face on the internet.
The action kicks off straight away. Three minutes into Episode 1, the police barge into a seemingly normal home in England, guns at the ready.

After passing by Jamie's parents — Manda Miller (Christine Tremarco), who drops to the ground in her bathrobe, and Eddie Miller (creator Stephen Graham) — the police arrest Jamie, still underneath the bed covers.
Jamie, looking very childlike, pleads his innocence. But the police searching the house for evidence imply he could be capable of a gruesome crime.
What is Jamie accused of? And what could have pushed him toward it? Below, find out the inspiration behind this intense story.
Is 'Adolescence' based on a true story?
Stephen Graham, the show's co-creator who also played Eddie Miller, told Netflix's press site Tudum that a series of recent stabbings by boys inspired the tale.

“There was an incident where a young boy (allegedly) stabbed a girl,” Graham said. “It shocked me. I was thinking, ‘What’s going on? What’s happening in society where a boy stabs a girl to death? What’s the inciting incident here?’ And then it happened again, and it happened again, and it happened again. I really just wanted to shine a light on it, and ask, ‘Why is this happening today? What’s going on? How have we come to this?’"

Fifteen-year-old Elianne Andam, for example, was stabbed to death in London in September by Hassan Sentamu, then 17. Sentamu was sentenced to a minimum of 23 years in prison per a March court sentencing.

Graham said that with the show, one of his goals was to answer the question, "What is happening to our young men these days and what are the pressures they face from their peers, from the internet and from social media?"
"And the pressures that come from all of those things are as difficult for kids here as they are the world over," he continued to tell Tudum.
Graham told Rolling Stone that when he sees these stories of kids committing violent acts on the news, he knows he's "not alone in blaming the parents sometimes."
Because of this, he wanted to create a narrative where the crime decidedly isn't the parents' fault.

“I thought to myself, ‘What if it’s not the parents?’ I wanted the dad to be a hardworking man, the kind of man that I was brought up with, like my uncles and my dad, who used to go to work at, like, 6 in the morning and not get home till 8 o’clock at night, Monday to Friday," he told the publication.

"I didn’t want him to be a violent dad who would raise his hand to his children. It’s the same for the mum too; we imagined her as a manager for John Lewis. Let’s take all of those normal common denominators away from the table, and let’s just concentrate on something that’s happened with the boy here.”
Instead of his parents, it's the internet, and certain radical groups, that have an impact on Jamie. He was inspired by looking at his own son's interactions with friends and social media use.
"It was just about looking at the influence that certain people can have upon our children without our knowledge," he said.
As an example, Graham said his son sent him a workout video. A few days after watching the video, his algorithm showed him the same creator, this time spouting "misogynistic opinions and views."

“I was able to say, ‘Yeah, that’s not for me,’ but what if I was a 13-year-old boy who didn’t really have an ideal relationship with my father, and all of a sudden I’m seeing this man who has everything I aspire to have — a fancy car and loads of money — this man who is everything I, maybe, aspire to be. If you’re influencing the youth with your own views and opinions, then surely you know that we need to be mindful of what’s being said?”
As for the project as a whole, Graham tells Rolling Stone it's something he's "very proud to have been a part of."
“I just hope it can raise some extremely important conversations," he added.

title: The 'best' since 'Baby Reindeer': About 'Adolescence,' the new series sweeping Netflix
summary: What is Adolescence? About the series that is on Netflix and getting rave reviews from critics and what critics are saying.
story: Every parent’s nightmare comes to life in Stephen Graham’s crime drama “Adolescence,” which focuses on the life of a 13-year-old boy named Jamie Miller (Owen Miller) who is accused of murdering a classmate.

In addition to creating the show, Graham also plays Eddie Miller, Jamie’s father. The rest of the cast includes Ashley Walters ("Top Boy"), Erin Doherty ("The Crown") and Faye Marsay ("Game of Thrones").
Released on March 13, "Adolescence" is the No. 1. English-language show on Netflix in the U.S, as of the publication of this article.

Part of what makes this show gripping is how the mystery unfolds. Filmed in one continuous shot, the characters try to understand the truth of what really happened in real time. Broader themes of toxic masculinity and the importance of teaching boys to rely on community, not just themselves, emerge.

“One of our aims was to ask, ‘What is happening to our young men these days, and what are the pressures they face from their peers, from the internet, and from social media?’ ” Graham told Netflix's press site Tudum. “And the pressures that come from all of those things are as difficult for kids here as they are the world over.”
What are critics saying about 'Adolescence'?
“Adolescence” has an approval rating of 100% on Rotten Tomatoes.
Rolling Stone's Alan Sepinwall called the series "an early contender for the best thing ... you will see on the small screen this year."
J. Kelly Nestruck of the Globe & Mail called the show Netflix’s best since “Baby Reindeer,” which premiered last April.
Critics spoke of the emotional impact it had on them, and potentially will have on viewers.
"Adolescence is likely to haunt you for quite some time," Matt Roush said for TV Insider, giving it a 5 out of 5 ranking.
The Times' Tom Peck called the show "complete perfection" and said, "I don’t think I broke my gaze from the TV for so much as a second. I may not even have blinked."
They also touched on how the story will strike viewers as relevant.

"This is a show that focuses on what the title promises: adolescence, and the unexpected dark turns it can take — particularly for boys," Amber Dowling wrote for The Wrap, calling it "an addictive but impossibly hard watch."

Television critic Robert Lloyd of the Los Angeles Times wrote, “It’s primarily about family, and self-reflection, and especially fathers and sons, and if the series doesn’t wind down to a traditional conclusion, it achieves a novelistic power in the end.”

The Hollywood Reporter's Daniel Fienberg says the show is more than thriller, but a meditation on the specific difficulties of being, and raising, a young man in the modern era, writing, “The mystery of what Jamie did or didn’t do is relevant but secondary to bigger questions about masculinity — be it toxic or fragile — in a world of bullying, revenge porn and noxious virtual role models like the name-checked Andrew Tate. The nightmare of murder gets a little lost in the more pervasive nightmare of, well, adolescence.”
Other creators are weighing in, too. Director Paul Feig wrote about the impact the show had on him in a tweet.

"The first episode of the @netflix show Adolescence is one of the best hours of television I’ve ever seen. An emotional and technological masterwork, the show works on all levels. I can’t wait to watch the rest of the episodes. Huge congrats to all involved," he wrote on X.
Where to watch ‘Adolescence’
The four episode series is available to stream now on Netflix. Each episode is about one hour long.

title: The final season of ‘Yellowstone’ is now streaming. How to watch
summary: How to watch Yellowstone Season 5, Part 2 and the final episodes which are all streaming on Peacock after airing on Paramount.
story: "Yellowstone" fans didn’t have to wait long for the show’s final season to start streaming.
Following the series finale, which aired on Paramount Network on Dec. 15, the second half of Season 5 became available to stream in March.
The final installment features six episodes and ends with a bang, in true "Yellowstone" fashion.
Eager to binge watch the last few episodes? Here's everything you need to know.
Where can I watch the last season of ‘Yellowstone’?
Season 5: Part 2 of "Yellowstone" started streaming on Peacock on March 16. Fans of the show can now watch the entire series on the streaming service.
What happens in the final season of  ‘Yellowstone’?
"Yellowstone" had viewers on the edge of their seats from the get go, so it was no surprise that the series ended with a shocking moment.

In the series finale, the Dutton family sells their land back to Broken Rock Reservation. Earlier in the season, the family's patriarch John (Kevin Costner) was killed. He is laid to rest in the finale.

Vowing to avenge her father's death, Beth (Kelly Reilly) visits her brother Jamie (Wes Bentley) and proceeds to attack him since he'd played a role in John's death. Lucky for Beth, Rip (Cole Hauser) arrives right on time and saves her from being choked. Beth then stabs and kills Jamie.
As Beth devised a plan to tell the police that Jamie ran off after attacking her, Rip get rid of his body.
In the end, Beth and Rip move forward with their lives and buy a new ranch.
Will there be any additional ‘Yellowstone’ spinoffs?
After the series finale of "Yellowstone" premiered, many fans of the show were curious to know if there would be a potential spinoff focused on Beth and Rip.
In December 2024, Deadline reported that a series was in the works. Viewers are still waiting for confirmation.
In the meantime, fans can get their "Yellowstone" fix by tuning in to the prequel series “1923.”
The show premiered in December 2022 on Paramount+ and stars Helen Mirren and Harrison Ford as Cara and Jacob Dutton, ancestors of the Dutton family.
The show is set in the early 20th century and follows the couple as they travel through the mountains of the American West.
In December 2024, "1923" started airing on cable for the first time when it hit Paramount Network.
Season 2 of "1923" premiered on Feb. 23, 2025 and is streaming exclusively on Paramount+.

title: T-Pain has the best response after fans point out he looks just like this NFL player
summary: T-Pain joked on X about his apparent doppelgänger when he saw the New York Giants signed James Hudson III from the Cleveland Browns.
story: When it comes to the New York Giants turning their fortunes around, it’s no T-Pain, no gain.

The NFL franchise announced March 13 on X that it had signed offensive lineman James Hudson III, and fans couldn’t help but point out that the picture of him the team used looked an awful lot like T-Pain.
"Thought TPain started playing football for a second," one fan commented.
"Is that t pain?!" someone else asked.
"We signed T Pain?" someone else wrote.
The Grammy-winning rapper himself got in on the fun, too.
“I’m finna turn this franchise around,” he joked while sharing the Giants' post, referring to the team's recent struggles on the field.
Hudson also couldn't resist getting in the spirit of things with his doppelgänger.
"Aye chill out,” he replied to T-Pain, along with a laughing emoji.
The "Buy U a Drank" rapper's post has resonated with fans, generating more than 318,000 likes and spurring one Giants fan account to lament the team’s struggles under center.
“Mr. Pain, Jokes aside, we need a quarterback. Talk soon?” the account asked.

Hudson had spent the entirety of his four-year NFL career with the Cleveland Browns before signing with the Giants, who are coming off one of the most disastrous seasons in team history. They went 3-14 and are set to pick third in next month’s NFL draft, so if T-Pain has any ideas about how to score more points, while allowing opposing teams to score fewer, maybe he'd be interested in contacting the Giants.

title: Doechii recorded 'Anxiety' in her bedroom years ago. Why it's a hit now
summary: Doechii's "Anxiety" song has gone viral on social media. Read the lyrics to the song and find out what it means!
story: Social media has fallen in love with Doechii's "Anxiety."

Doechii, whose real name is Jaylah Ji’mya Hickmon, first recorded the song in her bedroom. Until recently, the song was only available on YouTube as part of her "Coven Music Sessions," first posted in 2020.

“Anxiety” samples Gotye and Kimbra’s song “Somebody That I Used to Know.” While Gotye sings about the pain of losing a romantic partner in his smash hit, Doechii instead raps about the struggles she faces from constant worrying.

A few years after Doechii dropped the song, rapper Sleepy Hollow used the hook from the chorus to make his own track of the same name. Sleepy Hollow's version arrived in 2023 and it reached No. 44 on Billboard's Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs.
Recently, the spotlight has been on Doechii. She swept the Grammys earlier this year, winning best new artist, best rap album and best rap performance for her album "Alligator Bites Never Heal."

While "Anxiety" is not on her award-winning album, the song picked up steam on TikTok, where it inspired a dance trend. Using the song, people have been re-creating a scene from "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" where Will Smith sneaks up on Ashley Banks (Tatyana Ali) and copies her dance moves.
The trend brings the song's chorus to life: "Somebody’s watchin’ me / It’s my anxiety, yeah."
Doechii released the full version of her song on March 4, years after she first recorded it. She also explained the timeline of the "Anxiety" saga in a March 4 TikTok announcing the song's release.

"OK, so just a quick rundown on 'Anxiety,'" she said while talking fast. "'Anxiety' is a song that Sleepy Hollow dropped, but, he sampled my song, and then I, years ago, did a remix of 'Somebody That I Used To Know.' I titled it, 'Anxiety,' and I wrote a completely different song, and now it's blowing up on TikTok, and everybody's requesting it and it's out now!"
What is 'Anxiety' about?
"Anxiety" is about what appears to be Doechii's experiences with worrying and mental health.
She describes the physical sensation of anxiety in the lyrics, saying it's like a "tightness" in her chest — or "lke an elephant is standin’ on me."
The song is a battle between anxiety and Doechii's higher mind. At points in the song, Doechii lets anxiety "take over," and at other points, she fights back.
She likens anxiety to something that is trying to “silence” her. She is aware and tries to counteract its effects: “Gotta shake it off of me” and “can’t let it caution me,” she sings at points.
But it’s a battle. The song ends with the back-and-forth experience of anxiety, like a spiral — wanting to shake it off, being unable to, then trying again.
“Can’t shake it off of me, shake, shake it off of me / It’s my anxiety, gotta shake it off of me,” she sings, creating a sense of lingering unease.
